cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi (180 km) SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, enter the southeastern Gulf Saturday, then continue northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) by Sunday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect for the Cayman Islands and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Cayman Islands; Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, Havana, Artemisa, Pinar del Rio, and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cayman Islands, western Cuba, the northeastern Yucatán, and the U.S. north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; breezy conditions possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Manatee County coast with current track well to the west
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip currents and seas along the west-central Florida coast
